intro: Delphinastrum tricorne, commonly known as the three-cornered lespedeza, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for wildlife.
